title: Uttarkashi disaster: Video shows Dharali destroyed in 20 seconds; buildings crumbled like cardboard
content: Terrifying videos captured the moment a massive wave of water and debris devastated Dharali village in Uttarkashi district, flattening buildings and sweeping away people. The surge, triggered around 1:50 pm, reduced the bustling marketplace to rubble in seconds. Authorities have confirmed four deaths, but fear the toll could rise as rescue operations continue, with the Army, NDRF, and SDRF involved.

title: 'Another Pak diplomat quits': Army recalls 1971 war 'build-up'; highlights it in 'this day that year' post
content: The Army revisits the 1971 war with Pakistan. Newspaper clippings from 1971 show Pakistan's military buildup. They also highlight unrest in then-East Pakistan. The US backed Pakistan during the war. This reminder follows India's rejection of US criticism over energy trade with Russia. Tensions between India and Pakistan are currently high after a terror attack.

title: Fake cops, crypto trail: All you need to know about Rs 260cr global cyber fraud
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has launched an investigation into a Rs 260 crore global cyber fraud, conducting searches across multiple cities. Fraudsters impersonated law enforcement and tech support to extort money from victims. The illicit funds were converted into cryptocurrency, then laundered through hawala channels and individuals in the UAE.

title: Sachin breaks silence on handshake drama, asks 'Why should bowlers be kept fresh?'
content: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy concluded in a 2-2 draw, marked by the controversial handshake refusal by Jadeja and Sundar in the fourth Test. Sachin Tendulkar has strongly defended the Indian team's decision, emphasising the strategic advantage of tiring out England's bowlers before the crucial fifth Test. He lauded Sundar's adaptability and reiterated his full support for the team's approach.

title: If India cuts Russian crude under US pressure, will inflation rise? RBI guv responds
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra downplayed fears of significant inflation from reduced Russian oil imports, citing diversified sources and potential government fiscal measures. His remarks come amid US tariff threats over India's Russian oil purchases, which India has rejected. Despite geopolitical tensions, the RBI held its repo rate steady, forecasting stable growth and controlled inflation.

title: Microsoft planning stricter 'return to office' policy, requiring employees to ...
content: Microsoft is considering a stricter 'Return to Office' policy, potentially requiring Redmond employees to work from the office at least three days a week starting January 2026. This shift marks a change from their flexible hybrid model, aligning Microsoft with companies like Amazon and Dell.

title: CBSE mandates 75% attendance for board exam eligibility: Rule effective from 2026; key details
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has mandated 75% minimum attendance for Class 10 and 12 students in the 2025–26 session to qualify for the 2026 board exams. Strict exemptions, surprise inspections, and zero tolerance for manipulated records underscore the board’s renewed push to curb dummy candidates and enforce academic discipline across affiliated schools.

title: Trump was asked about India’s claim on US importing Russian uranium, fertilisers; his response
content: Amidst criticism over India's Russian oil purchases, US President Donald Trump claimed ignorance about the US importing fertilizers and chemicals from Russia. He accused India of profiting from reselling Russian oil and threatened tariff hikes, prompting a strong rebuttal from India, which cited strategic necessity and questioned the hypocrisy of Western nations continuing their trade with Russia.

title: 'Don't burn him out': Ex-India pacer sounds alarm, says Siraj is in Bumrah's league
content: Following Mohammed Siraj's impressive performance in England, RP Singh cautioned against overworking him, emphasising the need for careful workload management akin to Jasprit Bumrah to prevent potential burnout. Singh highlighted Siraj's indispensable role and partnership with Bumrah, advocating for strategic team selections and like-for-like injury substitutions to maintain team balance and player well-being.

title: Angry at Mira Murati for refusing $1bn offer, Zuckerberg launched 'full-scale raid'
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: Trump's tariff threat on India: What RBI guv Sanjay Malhotra said on GDP growth
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra acknowledges the difficulty in predicting the impact of potential US tariffs on India's GDP growth. While the central bank retained its 6.5% GDP forecast for fiscal year 2025-26 and kept the repo rate unchanged, Malhotra emphasized ongoing global uncertainties.

title: Perplexity under fire: Cloudflare says AI bots faked identities to bypass site blocks
content: Perplexity, an AI search startup, faces allegations from Cloudflare of using deceptive tactics to bypass website restrictions. Cloudflare claims Perplexity's bots disguised themselves as regular users to scrape content from blocked domains, raising concerns about unauthorized data usage. Perplexity denies wrongdoing, attributing the activity to third-party traffic and user-driven requests.

title: NSDL IPO listing: Company makes strong debut; shares list 15% higher than issue price of Rs 800
content: NSDL shares debuted strongly on Wednesday, listing at a 15% premium over the issue price of Rs 800, reaching Rs 920 and a market valuation of Rs 18,249 crore. The Rs 4,011 crore IPO was oversubscribed 41 times.

title: INDIA bloc to meet at Rahul's residence on Aug 7- What's on the agenda
content: Opposition INDIA bloc leaders are set to convene in Delhi on August 7 to strategize against PM Modi's alleged misinformation ahead of assembly polls. Discussions will encompass the Pahalgam attack and 'Operation Sindoor,' alongside concerns regarding Bihar's voter list revision.

title: IPL Rumours: Sanju Samson to stay! RR captain not going anywhere
content: Sanju Samson will remain with Rajasthan Royals. He will not be traded before the 2026 Indian Premier League. Recent speculation linked him to Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings. Rajasthan Royals have decided to retain Samson. He is an integral part of the team. Samson is also the captain. He aims for a strong performance in the upcoming season.

title: Trump, Gretzky and Tkachuk to revive youth Presidential Fitness Test
content: Donald Trump's President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition includes Wayne Gretzky and Matthew Tkachuk. The Council will focus on fitness in schools. It aims to restore college athletic customs and protect women's sports. Matthew Tkachuk impressed the White House during the Florida Panthers' visit. He will help shape fitness programs for kids.

title: KL Rahul melts hearts as he shares pic of daughter Evaarah holding his finger
content: Indian cricketer KL Rahul shared heartwarming photos from his England break, including a touching image of his baby daughter Evaarah clutching his finger. The post, which also featured moments with his brother-in-law Ahan Shetty, quickly garnered love from fans and family. Suniel Shetty and Ranveer Singh expressed their affection, celebrating the sweet family moments of Rahul and Athiya Shetty.

title: Repo rate kept unchanged at 5.5%; what does it mean for your loan EMIs?
content: The RBI's MPC has maintained the repo rate at 5.5% in its August review, offering no immediate EMI relief for borrowers, despite previous cuts. While a 1% repo rate reduction this year hasn't fully translated to lower EMIs, expectations are for future reductions. This decision occurs amidst potential tariff hikes by the US due to India's oil trade with Russia.

title: Uttarakhand flash floods: Homes buried, roads blocked; PM Modi dials CM Dhami - latest developments
content: A devastating flash flood struck Dharali village in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, triggered by a cloudburst. The deluge of water and debris flattened buildings, trapping dozens and resulting in casualties. Rescue operations are under way by army and NDRF teams, with efforts focused on clearing debris and restoring connectivity amidst challenging weather conditions. PM Modi assured full central support to CM Dhami.

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: Rules flouted for profit? Experts blame unchecked construction, tourism push
content: Environmentalists suggest that unchecked construction and human activity within the Bhagirathi Eco-Sensitive Zone exacerbated the recent devastating flood in Dharali village. They highlight that unregulated development disrupts natural drainage and accelerates land degradation. Experts are calling for stricter land-use regulations, comprehensive climate monitoring, and sustainable tourism practices to protect the vulnerable Himalayan ecosystem.

title: T20 History! Rashid Khan shines at Lord’s, becomes first bowler ever to ...
content: Rashid Khan marked his return to competitive cricket with a historic milestone, becoming the first player to reach 650 T20 wickets. Playing for Oval Invincibles in The Hundred 2025, he took 3/11 against London Spirit, showcasing his spin mastery. His performance, combined with Sam Curran's, led the Invincibles to a comfortable victory, starting their title defense strongly.

title: 'Reason he can't stand up to Trump is ...': Rahul's fresh charge at PM
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused PM Modi of being unable to confront President Trump's tariff threats due to the ongoing US investigation into Adani. Gandhi alleges that Modi's silence stems from potential exposure of financial links between Modi, Adani, and Russian oil deals. The opposition has been criticizing PM Modi and the BJP government over Trump's tariff threats and penalties for business with Russia.

title: NEET UG round 1 revised counselling schedule: Key updates out- check imp dates
content: The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) has released a revised Round 1 schedule for NEET UG 2025 counselling, following an abrupt suspension of the choice filling process. The updated timeline, issued on August 6, extends key deadlines including registration, now open until 3 PM today. The move brings clarity for medical aspirants and resumes the AIQ admission process.

title: EXCLUSIVE | ‘If we are serious about 2036 bid...’ - Abhinav Bindra
content: Abhinav Bindra supports India's ambition to host the 2036 Olympic Games, emphasizing its potential to inspire a generation and drive national development. He stresses the importance of focusing on athlete development and building robust sports systems. Bindra believes that investing in athletes and grassroots participation is crucial for India to be competitive by 2036.

title: Uttarakhand cloudburst: Roorkee-born Pant 'deeply saddened' as devastation hits Uttarkashi
content: Following cloudbursts and continuous rainfall in Uttarakhand, cricketer Rishabh Pant expressed his concern for those affected and urged them to stay strong. The rising water level in the Ganga River prompted alerts, while Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami surveyed affected areas and initiated large-scale rescue operations involving multiple agencies to save stranded individuals amidst flooding and landslides.

title: 'Means a lot': Pant wins hearts, funds college admission for a student
content: Rishabh Pant demonstrated his compassionate side by assisting Jyoti Kanaboor Math, a bright student from Karnataka, in achieving her academic aspirations. Despite scoring 83% in her Class 12 exams, Jyoti faced financial constraints that threatened her BCA enrollment. Pant's timely intervention, a Rs 40,000 donation, ensured her admission and first-semester fees were covered, earning him gratitude and admiration.

title: 'I never said a percentage': Trump on increasing tariffs on countries buying Russian oil
content: Donald Trump has threatened to impose substantial tariffs on India for continuing to purchase Russian oil, despite criticism from within his own party. Nikki Haley cautioned against harming relations with India while seemingly giving China a pass. India has defended its oil imports, citing diverted traditional supplies and pointing out that other nations also trade with Russia.

title: Forged resident card: Indian man arrested in New York; faces 10 years in jail
content: Swapnil Ramesh Tejale, an Indian citizen, faced arrest in the US. The arrest occurred due to possession of a fake resident card. Authorities took him into custody in Niagara Falls, New York. He faces a potential 10-year prison sentence. The arrest is part of 'Operation Take Back America'. This initiative targets illegal immigration.

title: 'Will call PM Modi': Brazil's Lula snubs Trump amid tariff row
content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva plans to challenge Donald Trump's 50% tariffs by contacting global leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Xi Jinping. Despite tensions, Lula will use the WTO to defend Brazil's interests. He refuted Trump's justification for the tariffs, viewing it as an attack on Brazil's sovereignty.

title: Visa delays strand students: Thousands stuck abroad; US colleges face financial hit
content: Thousands of international students remain stranded as US visa delays under the Trump administration disrupt fall enrollments, threatening billions in tuition revenue. Universities like Arizona State and Furman report significant shortfalls, while students face rejections and lack of appointments. Institutions scramble with backup plans abroad, as America’s higher education appeal faces serious global erosion.

title: TN MP chain snatching case solved: Accused nabbed in Delhi; scooter hunt leads to arrest
content: Delhi Police successfully solved the chain snatching case involving Tamil Nadu MP R Sudha near the Poland Embassy in Chanakyapuri. The accused was apprehended, and the stolen gold chain, weighing over four sovereigns, was recovered. Police traced the suspect using CCTV footage, identifying a blue scooter used in the crime, leading to the arrest in connection with the high-profile incident.

title: IND vs ENG: Mohammed Siraj conquers snubs, trolls and misfortune
content: Mohammed Siraj’s fiery spirit defined India’s drawn Test series in England. Overlooked, misjudged, and trolled, he rose through relentless spells, emotional resilience, and raw hunger. From rubber slippers in Toli Chowki to nine SENA wins, Siraj’s journey is a testament to belief. At The Oval, he didn’t just take wickets — he emerged from Bumrah’s shadow.

title: IND vs ENG: Transition is over! Gill & Gambhir deliver powerful statement
content: Shubman Gill and Gautam Gambhir's coach-captain partnership has started strongly, drawing a challenging five-Test series in England. Gill's leadership and Gambhir's focus on team over individuals have instilled confidence in a young Indian side. With senior players retiring and Bumrah's availability managed carefully, the team is looking ahead, potentially revisiting ODI leadership with Gill as a key figure.

title: NSA Doval in Russia amid Trump tariff threat: Key talks with Kremlin; will oil be on agenda?
content: Ajit Doval's Moscow visit centers on strengthening the strategic partnership, defense, and security cooperation between India and Russia amid evolving geopolitical dynamics. Discussions will encompass defense collaboration and Russian oil supplies to India. The visit occurs against the backdrop of US trade threats and criticism regarding India's energy imports from Russia, which India defends as safeguarding its national interests.

title: Watch: Siraj arrives in India after stellar England series, fans hail ‘Miyan Magic’
content: Mohammed Siraj, the Indian pace sensation, returned to India after a stellar performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, where he emerged as the leading wicket-taker with 23 scalps. His crucial spells, including a six-wicket haul at Birmingham and a five-wicket spell at The Oval, solidified his role as a key figure in India's pace attack, especially with Bumrah's absence.

title: Uttarakhand cloudburst: Rain alert forces school closures across four districts
content: Uttarakhand authorities have shut all schools and Anganwadi centres in Almora, Pithoragarh, Chamoli, and Rudraprayag districts following an IMD warning of heavy rainfall. The move aims to protect students amid flash flood and landslide risks. Haridwar faces waterlogging, while a boulder on the Haridwar-Dehradun rail route has disrupted train services, prompting high alert across the state.

title: 'Death to Trump': Bengaluru man in Scotland court for threat to bomb easyJet flight
content: Abhay Devdas Nayak, a Bengaluru resident, faced court in Scotland. He is accused of threatening to bomb an easyJet flight. Nayak allegedly shouted "Allahu Akbar" during the incident. Passengers were terrified on the Luton to Glasgow flight. He reportedly made threats against America and former President Trump. Nayak is remanded in custody. Bengaluru police have limited information about Nayak.

title: Stock market: Nifty50, BSE Sensex trade lower after RBI keeps repo rate unchanged
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in flat in trade on Wednesday ahead of the RBI monetary policy review decision.

title: Mukesh Khanna defends SRK's National Award win
content: The entertainment industry celebrated the National Awards, but Shah Rukh Khan's first win sparked debate. South actress Urvashi questioned the fairness, while Mukesh Khanna defended SRK, highlighting his decades of hard work. Khan expressed gratitude, viewing the award as a reminder of his responsibility to cinema and a motivation to continue striving.

title: ‘Bhag, bhag!’: Man defies death, crawls out of debris as flash flood flattens Uttarkashi village - watch
content: A man miraculously survived a flash flood in Uttarkashi's Dharali village on Tuesday. Dramatic videos show him crawling from the debris after the deluge destroyed homes and roads. Though injured and covered in mud, he managed to escape the immediate danger. His identity and condition remain unknown, and it's unconfirmed if he received medical attention.

title: 'Languishes in premature retirement': Tharoor reignites call for Kohli's Test comeback
content: Shashi Tharoor has stirred debate by questioning Virat Kohli's Test retirement, deeming it premature after India's drawn series in England. He contrasted Kohli's situation with Joe Root's continued excellence, emphasising Kohli's potential impact on the recent series. Tharoor's appeal highlights Kohli's past success and leadership, igniting calls for his return to Test cricket.

title: Bird slams into plane: Cabin filled with smoke mid-air on Paris flight— watch
content: A Paris-bound plane from Madrid was compelled to make an emergency landing shortly after takeoff due to a bird strike, causing panic among passengers. The collision severely damaged the plane's nose, leading to smoke in the cabin and the deployment of oxygen masks.

title: Chennai Grand Masters: Tournament postponed after fire disrupts venue - Watch
content: The Chennai Grand Masters 2025 has been delayed by a day due to a fire at the Hyatt Regency, its venue. All players are safe and relocated. The tournament will now commence on August 7, with the first round on the original rest day.

title: Gold price prediction: Where is yellow metal rate headed? Here’s the outlook
content: Gold prices are expected to remain range-bound with limited upward movement in the near term, according to Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. Despite a Friday rally driven by weak US job data and tariff concerns, a stronger US Dollar and risk-on sentiment are capping gains.

title: Baby bonus: China offers 10,800 yuan per child to boost birth rate
content: In the last week of July, the government announced a new plan to increase the birth rate. Parents will receive an annual subsidy of 3,600 yuan (about $500) for every child until the age of three. This scheme applies to children born since January 1, 2025. Over three years, a family can get up to 10,800 yuan for each child.

title: "If Courts Won't Decide Who Is National...": BJP On Rebuke To Rahul Gandhi
content: The Gandhi family cannot not be allowed to believe that they are above the judiciary, senior Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Amit Malviya said on Wednesday.

title: Top Court Stays Trial Against YouTuber Elvish Yadav In Snake Venom Case
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday stayed proceedings in the trial court against YouTuber Elvish Yadav in the snake venom case.

title: Analysis: More Political Optics In Revanth Reddy's Delhi Dharna?
content: The dharna at Jantar Mantar today is meant to create the political optics of Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy and the Congress as champions of reservation for the backward classes, attempting to put the central government on the defensive.

title: Uttarkashi Flash Floods: 1 Body Recovered, Over 60 Missing, Rescue Ops On
content: Rescuers retrieved one body from the rubble in flood-ravaged Dharali village, as the search for the missing resumed on Wednesday amid rain.

title: UP Minister's "Ganga At Doorstep" Remark Draws Sharp Opposition Counter
content: Uttar Pradesh Fisheries Minister Sanjay Nishad has sparked controversy during his visit to a flood-affected area in Kanpur Dehat where he told a woman that the Ganga river has reached "your doorstep to clean your feet".

title: "Bashed With Gun, I Played Dead": Israeli Survivor Narrates Hamas Attack
content: On October 7, 2023, the world watched in horror as Hamas launched a brutal attack on Israel, killing around 1,200 people and taking 251 hostages.

title: Uttarkashi Cloudburst Live Updates: Chief Minister Dhami Reaches Flood-Hit Uttarkashi, Says 130 Rescued
content: Uttarakashi Cloudburst LIVE Updates: A cloudburst struck Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district on Tuesday afternoon which triggered a mudslide and flash floods in Dharali village.

title: Stanford University Lays Off 363 Employees Due To Funding Cuts By Trump
content: Stanford University said on Tuesday it has laid off over 360 employees, citing budget constraints that it attributed to the federal funding policies of US President Donald Trump.

title: Actor Vijay Deverakonda At Probe Agency Office Over Online Betting Case
content: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in Hyderabad today in connection with a money laundering investigation linked to the promotion of illegal online betting applications.

title: Why Uttarkashi Is A Disaster Hotspot: The Geography Explained
content: A sudden cloudburst triggered flash floods and landslides in Uttarkashi on Tuesday, killing four and leaving at least 50 missing

title: Video: Paris-Bound Flight Makes Emergency Landing After Bird Hits Plane Nose
content: A Paris-bound Iberia flight was forced to make an emergency landing shortly after takeoff on Sunday after a bird struck the aircraft's nose.

title: 5th Body Retrieved After Uttarakhand Cloudburst, Weather Warning For Himachal
content: Disaster swept through Dharali village in Uttarakhand on Tuesday after a massive cloudburst triggered flash floods that barrelled through homes, trees and vehicles, trapping dozens of people and leaving at least five dead.

title: Nighttime Coffee Drinking May Increase Impulsivity In Women: Study
content: The findings could have negative implications for shift workers, health care, and military personnel who consume coffee at night, particularly females, said a team of biologists from The University of Texas at El Paso (UTEP).

title: Bengaluru Techie Loses 55 Lakhs In Crypto Fraud On Matrimony Site
content: A 32-year-old IT professional from Ullal Upanagara in Bengaluru has filed a police complaint alleging he was cheated of over Rs 55 lakh by fraudsters.

title: Man Killed Father 8 Years Ago. Cop Brother's Highway Murder Revenge
content: A man jailed for killing his father, his brother counting days, months, years for revenge, a teenage girl luring the target, and a highway shooting by hired killers -- murder in Shivpuri has shown truth can be more sinister than fiction

title: "Course Correction, Not Concession": Omar Abdullah's Letter For Statehood
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has written to the presidents of all national parties for the restoration of Jammu and Kashmir's statehood.

title: PM Dials Uttarakhand Chief Minister Over Uttarkashi Cloudburst, Assures All Help
content: PM Modi on Wednesday spoke with the Uttarakhand Chief Minister over the phone and inquired about the grim situation in Uttarkashi's Dharali region, which was hit by twin cloudbursts, sweeping away an entire village and leaving several missing.

title: Case Filed Against 2 Navi Mumbai Doctors After 5 Patients Contract Infections
content: Five patients suffered from serious eye infections after an operation at a prominent eye hospital in Navi Mumbai, prompting police to register a case against two ophthalmologists who conducted the surgeries without having a license.

title: Rivers Across 8 States Flow Above Danger Mark As Heavy Rain Continues
content: Several rivers across Assam, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, Madhya Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and West Bengal are flowing above danger levels, posing a risk to the people living in the low-lying areas.

title: 413 Pilgrims Rescued Via Zipline, Cloudbursts Wash Away Bridge In Himachal
content: Incidents of cloudbursts and heavy rains were reported in Kinnaur, with a bridge over the Tangling drain being washed away on Wednesday morning.

title: Latest buzz from NFL training camp: What we heard at 16 teams' practices, plus fantasy intel
content: Our national reporters visited 16 NFL teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: Sex toy tossed on Sparks' court, lands near player
content: A sex toy landed near Indiana's Sophie Cunningham after it was thrown from the stands in Los Angeles while the Fever played the Sparks on Tuesday night, the latest such incident to interrupt a WNBA game in the past seven days.

title: Jerry confident Parsons available for opener? 'No'
content: Cowboys owner and GM Jerry Jones is not confident Pro Bowl edge rusher Micah Parsons will be available for the Sept. 4 season opener against the Eagles. "No, absolutely not," Jones said Tuesday. "A big part of that is his decision. How would I know that?"

title: Gurriel makes history with HR off 103.9 mph pitch
content: Arizona outfielder Lourdes Gurriel Jr. crushed a 103.9 mph fastball from San Diego's Mason Miller into the left-field seats for a two-run homer in the eighth inning Tuesday night, the hardest-hit pitch for a homer since MLB started pitch tracking in 2008.

title: 49ers TE Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: Sasaki taking next step in rehab: No shoulder pain
content: Roki Sasaki says he has "no pain" in his right shoulder and is scheduled to pitch three simulated innings at Dodger Stadium over the weekend.

title: Former Heat security guard charged in $2M heist
content: A former Miami Heat security officer accused of selling stolen jerseys and other memorabilia worth millions of dollars made his initial appearance in federal court Tuesday.

title: 📸 Bulls bring back MJ-era pinstripe unis
content: Jordan and the Bulls first wore the threads during the 1995-96 campaign when the team went 72-10 and won a championship.

title: Bo Nix keeps passing every test
content: How did Broncos coach Sean Payton know Nix was the real deal? A finely tuned QB evaluation process told him, as detailed in the book "American Kings: A Biography of the Quarterback."

title: Team that cooked, most frustrated fan bases and more: Passan's trade deadline awards
content: What we learned from the deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: 'He never wanted to leave': How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with star injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without their stars.

title: WNBA trade grades: Report cards for every major deal
content: Adding Brittney Sykes gives Seattle the WNBA's most versatile perimeter trio ahead of the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: The 40 most important players in college football this season
content: From QBs on surefire CFP contenders to potential stars looking to break through, these players will shape the 2025 season.

title: Confidence, conditioning and catches: What we've learned about Travis Hunter so far
content: The Jaguars' dual receiver and cornerback has had an eventful two weeks in his first NFL training camp.

title: Clippers' Harden surprised with court reveal, design on China tour
content: A basketball court with a larger-than-life image of James Harden was revealed in Guangzhou, China, on Monday.

title: Are high-priced foreign players really ready for the jump to the Premier League?
content: Digging into why the Premier League is so much more challenging for players than any other league in the world.

title: Man United passed their preseason tests. Now comes the real challenge
content: It's going to take more than good vibes to get Man United back into the top half of the Premier League table.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Watkins linked with Man United amid Sesko pursuit
content: Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins could head to Manchester United, in the event that a move for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25 rankings: Every team's most important nonconference game
content: Regional rivalries, freshmen debuts and more of the most intriguing nonconference game to tune into for each preseason top 25 team.

title: Mock draft: QBs selected with five of first eight picks of 12-team PPR superflex
content: As expected, quarterbacks were popular early on, which meant some quality wide receivers and players with upside were available in the middle rounds.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts.

title: Pickups: Seven players seizing post-deadline opportunity
content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Betting buzz: Baldwin favorite as Misiorowski injury shakes up NL Rookie race
content: Drake Baldwin emerges as heavy NL Rookie of the Year favorite after Jacob Misiorowski's odds slide after injury.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: From another title in OKC to new plans in Phoenix, what is every team 'all-in' for in 2025-26?
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Chris Boucher to the Celtics
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Can Barça's title defense endure summer of self sabotage?
content: It's been one misstep after another for Barcelona, but on the field they're so strong it may not matter.

title: Missed wages, closed stand, quitting players: Why Sheffield Wednesday could go bust
content: Sheffield Wednesday are one of the most historically important clubs in England, but they could cease to exist.

title: 'I am useless': Hamilton spiraling in dire Ferrari debut year
content: In February, Lewis Hamilton was full of smiles, eager to win a championship for Ferrari. Six months later, he sounds defeated.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 QBs in Madden NFL 26
content: From Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson to Jayden Daniels, here are the top 10 quarterbacks in Madden NFL 26

title: Mohali blast: 2 killed, three injured in explosion at oxygen cylinder plant
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Here comes the Judge! AL MVP favorite returns
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . everything else will be played under clear conditions or in a dome . the new york Yankees will activate Aaron Judge from the 10-day IL in advance of Tuesday night's road tilt with the Texas Rangers .

title: ‘Ungaludan Stalin’ scheme: Supreme Court dismisses AIADMK MP’s challenge to nomenclature as ‘misconceived’ and an ‘abuse of law’
content: The Bench set aside a Madras High Court order imposing “sweeping restrictions” on the Tamil Nadu Government from naming State welfare schemes after “any living personality”

title: Man found dead in Sub-Inspector’s room at Coimbatore police station; police claim suicide
content: The incident sparked allegations of custodial death; however, Coimbatore City Police Commissioner A. Saravana Sundar claimed it was a case of death by suicide

title: INDIA bloc parties united, want discussion on SIR issue in Parliament: Kharge
content: Kharge claimed that minorities, Dalits and adivasis are facing the risk of losing their voting rights.

title: TASMAC money laundering case: Madras High Court fines ED for not filing counter affidavits to Akash Baskaran’s petitions
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan imposes the costs at the rate of ₹10,000 for each of the three writ petitions to which counter affidavits were not filed

title: Heavy rain, landslides cut off over 600 roads in Himachal Pradesh; schools closed in four districts
content: The State Emergency Operation Centre said 617 roads, including four national highways, were cut off; Kinnaur Kailash Yatra suspended

title: Game-changer virus developed by Kerala Forest Research Institute can help save teak plantations
content: HpNPV, identified and mass-developed by KFRI, offers eco-friendly alternative to chemical pesticides and prevents massive defoliation in teak

title: Maoist with ₹15 lakh bounty killed in gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand, say police
content: Bounty-carrying PLFI commander Martin Kerketta was killed in a gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand’s Gumla district;  search operation ongoing

title: Supreme Court stays trial court proceedings against YouTuber Elvish Yadav in snake venom case
content: The chargesheet alleges consumption of snake venom as a recreational drug at "rave" parties by people, including foreigners.

title: Kerala man booked for killing cat, posting video on Instagram
content: 32-year-old from Palakkad taken into custody following complaint from animal rights campaigner after disturbing video went viral

title: PM Modi inaugurates Kartavya Bhavan
content: Kartavya Bhavan-03, the first to be inaugurated, will house the Home Affairs, External Affairs, Rural Development, MSME, DoPT, Petroleum & Natural Gas Ministries, and the Principal Scientific Adviser's office

title: 25-year-old man shot dead by father-in-law in case of caste killing in Bihar
content: Rahul, a resident of Supaul, got married to Jha's daughter, who also studies at DMCH, in April. Jha was against the inter-caste marriage, and this could be the reason for the murder, says police

title: Supreme Court seeks ECI’s response to plea seeking individual reasons for deleting 65 lakh voters from Bihar draft electoral roll
content: The application said the reason for removing each name is not individually shown, either constituency-wise or booth-wise, in the draft roll

title: T.N. only State in India to achieve double-digit economic growth: CM Stalin
content: In a post on X, Mr. Stalin referred to a report published in The Hindu and said: “Tamil Nadu’s Dravidian model government stands tall as the only State in India to achieve double-digit economic growth.”

title: Gurugram police arrest 3 youths for performing car stunts on road
content: Gurugram police arrest three youths for performing dangerous car stunts on road, recover three cars used in stunt

title: ED raids in NCR, Uttarakhand in global cyber fraud case
content: The raids are being conducted under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) and are covering at least 11 premises located in Delhi, Noida, Gurugram and Dehradun, the sources said

title: Rahul Gandhi gets bail from Jharkhand court over ‘defamatory remarks’ against Amit Shah in 2018
content: A case of defamation was filed against Mr. Gandhi by a person named Pratap Kumar for allegedly making defamatory statements against the Union Home Minister at a rally in Chaibasa in 2018

title: Body of missing teen recovered after four-day search at Pathankayam waterfalls in Kerala
content: Alan went missing while he was bathing near the falls along with five other friends. Though the rescue squads immediately launched search operations, the heavy water currents turned out to be a challenge.

title: BJP MP raises concerns over Gaya airport code ‘GAY’; Govt says airport codes considered permanent
content: Minister of State for Civil Aviation Murlidhar Mohol said the three-letter airport codes are altered only under exceptional circumstances, usually involving air safety concerns

title: Sachin Pilot joins NSUI protest for restoration of student union elections in Rajasthan
content: Former Deputy Chief Minister Sachin Pilot joins NSUI protest demanding student union elections in Rajasthan, faces police action

title: ECI suspends four W.B. election officials
content: It has been stated in the complaint that the said officers have not only failed to perform duty as ERO and AERO while disposing off the applications but also violated the policy of data security while sharing their login credentials of the ER database with unauthorised persons

title: Bombay High Court refuses to monitor CM Relief Fund, says public can use RTI for accountability
content: The court said it cannot intervene in policy decisions but expects transparency and adherence to the fund’s stated objectives.

title: Fire breaks out at star hotel in Chennai; guests evacuated
content: No one was injured in the fire, which broke out in the pantry storage on the ninth floor of Hyatt Hotel, Teynampet

title: Emotional scenes as J&K L-G Sinha hands over jobs to 158 relatives of terror victims
content: The L-G administration has come up with a web portal to streamline and expedite the process of providing relief, compassionate appointments, and other forms of assistance to those who have suffered from terrorism

title: Vijay Deverakonda-starrer Kingdom’s distributor approaches Madras High Court seeking police protection for theatres in Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu theatrical rights holder seeks court order to prevent interference with Vijay Deverakonda’s ‘Kingdom’ movie screening, citing threats to cinema hall owners from Naam Tamilar Katchi cadres

title: Two militants among four held in Manipur
content: A 41-year-old active cadre of the banned Kanglei Yawol Kanna Lup was apprehended from his residence at Phumlou Keiroi Maning in Imphal West district

title: Opposition's demand for discussion on votebandi non-negotiable: Congress
content: There has been a logjam in Parliament over the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, which the Opposition has alleged is being done to cut votes ahead of the State election

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 13 LIVE: Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha adjourned till 2 p.m. amid Opposition protests
content: The Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar has sparked a political row, with the opposition INDIA bloc alleging that the revision process could lead to the deletion of a large number of voters.

title: Mamata visits flood affected areas in south Bengal; inspects condition, offers flood relief
content: A day ago, the CM blamed the Damodar Valley Corporation and their increased water release for flooding multiple districts of West Bengal; DVC officials have refuted the claims

title: NSA Ajit Doval in Moscow, as Trump delivers fresh threats of sanctions on Indian import of Russian oil
content: NSA Ajit Doval talks to discuss security cooperation, ahead of Putin’s visit to India this year, EAM Jaishankar expected to travel to Moscow soon

title: Call to unearth contemporary knowledge from Sanskrit
content: Odisha Governor Kambhampati Hari Babu called Sanskrit as not just a language, but a ‘living legacy’ that guides human life

title: How should money laundering be tackled? | Explained
content: What did the Finance Minister report with respect to the number of cases under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act? What are the three stages through which money is laundered? How will the Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement help to stop illegal transfer of money?

title: Bihar Cabinet approves domicile policy in school teachers’ appointment
content: Policy will give priority to Bihar’s youths over youths of other States. Cabinet also hiked honorariums for school cooks, watchmen, Physical Education instructors, Mamata, ASHA and Sanitation workers

title: Two Indian-origin men drown in Colorado river
content: Investigators said that the two victims had been underwater for approximately 20 minutes when divers arrived on scene and were located in approximately 12 feet of water

title: India, Russia reaffirm commitment to enhance defence cooperation
content: The meeting took place amid U.S. President Donald Trump’s threats to slap harsh sanctions on India for buying crude oil from Russia

title: Bombay High Court denies bail to ex-BJP MLA for shooting inside police station
content: The court observed that allowing a violent crime of such magnitude to occur within the secure confines of a police station undermines public confidence in the law enforcement system’s ability to uphold peace and order

title: Tunnel slope collapses in north Bengal’s Kalimpong area triggered by heavy rainfall
content: No casualties or injuries were reported from the ground even though the concrete structure collapsed within seconds

title: The importance of retaining College Road’s name
content: College Road does not take its name from Women’s Christian College but from the College of Fort St. George, which functioned at what is today the Directorate of Public Instructions premises, between 1812 and 1854

title: SIT to probe allegation of police burying girl’s body in Dharmasthala village without filing case
content: In the complaint filed with the Dharmasthala police on August 4, one T. Jayant alleged that the body of a 15-year-old girl was found lying on the roadside in the village between 2002 and 2003

title: Trump’s 25% tariff likely to hit seafood exports from Andhra Pradesh
content: Aqua farmers have to bear 35% tariff, including 25% tariff, 5.77% countervailing duty and 3.96% anti-dumping duty from August 7, says Seafood Exporters Association of India

title: What the 1871 educational census shows about the divide in the pyall schools of Madras Presidency
content: A forgotten 1871 census reveals how caste, class and religion shaped not just what children learned, but how much their teachers earned in British-era Madras Presidency

title: Over ₹1,000 crore siphoned off through cyber frauds in 4 years in Madhya Pradesh; recovery rate below 0.2%
content: Congress MLA Jaivardhan Singh said that the low recovery rate in cyber scam cases reflects that the police are “not at all equipped to deal with the problem of cyber fraud”.

title: A caste murder that shocked Chennai 14 years ago
content: The recent murder of Kavin Selvaganesh, a Scheduled Caste youth, by his girlfriend’s brother belonging to Most Backward Caste in Tirunelveli district has shaken Tamil Nadu. However, its a misconception that such crimes occur only in remote villages or the southern districts of the State. Even urban areas like Chennai witness such brutal acts driven by caste.

title: CDS Chauhan urges swift tech adoption and defence reforms amid evolving warfare
content: The CDS urged military practitioners to embrace a proactive, indigenous and adaptive vision anchored in strategic foresight, technological autonomy and doctrinal agility.

title: Open office concept in Central government offices irks officials
content: All Ministries are set to move to new office buildings built at Kartavya Path; however, the government officials’ body has said that in the new buildings, officers are being allotted lesser spaces than mandated, impacting confidentiality and efficiency

title: Honest officers must be protected: SC on challenges to amend anti-graft Act
content: The court was hearing a petition filed by the non-profit organisation challenging Section 17A of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988, which bars any “enquiry or inquiry or investigation” against a public servant for recommendations made in discharge of official duties without prior approval from the competent authority

title: DAC approves defence procurement worth ₹67,000 crore to strengthen border security
content: Acceptance of Necessity was accorded for the procurement of Medium Altitude Long Endurance (MALE) Remotely Piloted Aircraft (RPAs) for the three services.

title: House of Muthulakshmi Reddy, India’s first woman medicine graduate, in a dilapidated state
content: Sources in Avvai Home and Adyar Cancer Institute express willingness to renovate the building; Minister P.K. Sekarbabu promises to inspect the site soon and put the facility to good use

title: Chikungunya cases surge in Telangana; Centre and State report contradictory figures
content: The number presented in the Lok Sabha is wrong; we don’t know how that data was generated, but it is not consistent with our records, says Telangana Health officer

title: Hyderabad’s drain game fails: Collapsed vents suspected in Ameerpet deluge
content: Monday’s downpour exposed gaping holes, from collapsed vents and choked drains to under-capacity holding tanks, leaving key roads in Hyderabad inundated

title: Built-over lakes return to haunt prime areas of Hyderabad
content: In a span of two hours, with nearly 10 centimetres of rain lashing central parts of the city, stormwater rose through the old drainage routes

title: Manifold increase in rabies deaths in two years: Centre
content: In 2024, the highest number of rabies deaths was reported from Tamil Nadu (43), followed by Karnataka (42) and Andhra Pradesh (39). In 2023, 121 people died of rabies and 2,223 presumptive cases were reported

title: Do not summon petitioner to police station: High Court
content: Vadhtya Ramulu alleged that Maheshwaram police were harassing him since he sought a probe into purchase of Bhoodan lands by some IAS and IPS officers

title: Venugopal seeks closure of case against nuns held in Chhattisgarh
content: Congress leader writes to Home Minister and Chhattisgarh CM; demands action against Bajrang Dal members

title: Construction of Common Central Secretariat buildings to be over in 22 months: Khattar
content: Several ministries housed in Shastri Bhavan, Krishi Bhavan, Nirman Bhavan and Udyog Bhavan in the national capital will soon shift to new locations on Kasturba Gandhi Marg, Minto Road, and Netaji Palace temporarily for two years

title: ‘Kaiga units operated continuously for over 500 days on eight occasions’
content: The four units of KGS have operated continuously for over 500 days on eight occasions and over 365 days on 19 occasions, thus setting benchmark parameters for the operating stations of Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited

title: Kolhapur elephant row: Maharashtra government to file a review petition in SC over animal’s transfer to Vantara
content: Chief Minister Fadnavis says a special team will be formed to care for elephant Madhuri after her return from the rescue/rehabilitation centre

title: PMK senior leaders believe voters, and not office-bearers, will decide the party leadership
content: Both factions have started talking with other parties to ensure that they remain in pole position. While Dr. Anbumani has embarked on a padayatra, focusing on the PMK strongholds and presenting himself as the face of the party, Dr. Ramadoss, 86, is headlining a women’s conference at Poompuhar on August 10

title: WR Allen returns to Chargers, home for 11 years
content: WR keenan Allen returns to the Chargers, home for 11 years . he spent the first 11 years of his NFL career with the chargers . the 33-year-old will reunite with quarterback Justin Herbert . we have reporters with all 32 teams, covering the ins and outs of camp .

title: 'This is truly a startup': How the 'new' Pac-12 is taking shape
content: the Pac-12 has existed in various states of transition . the future is beginning to take shape, says commissioner Teresa Gould . "it's not the old Pac-12 -- it's a new Pac-12," says commissioner .

title: Training camp battles to watch for all 32 teams
content: training camps are off and running, and the 2025 season is right around the corner . players spend camp making their cases to be included on the final 53-man rosters at the end of august . coaches are seeking clarity on who starts and who will provide backup .

title: Biggest concern, what's left to play for and more: Post-trade-deadline guide for all 30 MLB teams
content: the 2025 trade deadline featured 92 veteran trade candidates on new teams . 92 prospects headed to new organizations seeking their big league opportunity . this is what we do with every edition of Stock Watch . there is never as much mystery in the outcomes as there is after a heavy period of roster movement .

title: Catching up on the Big 12: Power Rankings, key players, must-see games
content: the big 12 title looks to be available to nearly any team in the conference . the conference's elite will look to join the offseason . this year, Texas Tech, fresh off a massive push to bring in new talent . dillingham's Arizona State Sun Devils were picked in the preseason media poll .
